patterns: Where can I learn to code?
How do I get better at coding?
responses: Check out freecodecamp.org and The Odin Project. For videos, go for 'NeuralNine' or 'Tech with Tim'.
To get better, code daily — even if it's just a mini project!
LeetCode and HackerRank will train your problem-solving like a boss. Let’s get you interview-ready, Anas!
Loops let you repeat actions. Want a for-loop in Python or a while-loop in C++?
Functions help you avoid repeating code. They take inputs, do stuff, and return results!
Classes are templates for objects. OOP magic starts here 🪄
Inheritance allows a class to use another class’s methods — it’s like family coding trees!
Arrays are ordered collections. In Python: lists. In C++: arrays or vectors.

Segmentation fault means you accessed memory incorrectly — often in C/C++.
Syntax error? You probably missed a bracket or semicolon. Let’s fix it!
Infinite loops happen when the condition never turns false. Want to test one together?
Null pointer exception = using something that doesn't exist yet. Classic OOP error.
You've come this far, Anas — don’t stop now! Great things take time 💥
Every bug fixed is a level up. You’re not just coding, you're becoming legendary.
You're doing amazing. This chatbot itself is proof of your skills!

patterns: How do I prepare for a CS test?
responses: Practice writing code by hand — especially loops and recursion!
Focus on problem-solving. Don't memorize, understand.
Group study with smart friends (or this chatbot 😉) can really help!
